title: Software Developer
org: The University of Adelaide — Centre for Research on Engineering Software Technologies (CREST)
achievements: Delivered cross-platform applications to enhance accessibility and performance across multiple OS environments.
Integrated LLMs and foundational models to automate complex workflows and boost overall system intelligence.
responsibilities: Analysed system bottlenecks and proposed technical enhancements for scalability and reliability.
Designed, implemented, and deployed applications across Linux, Windows, and Android environments using React, React Native, TypeScript, and Python.
Built and maintained retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems leveraging vector and graph databases (Milvus, Neo4j, PostgreSQL) to optimise semantic retrieval.
Integrated machine-learning models and automation tools (Ollama, Gemini, Llama, HuggingFace) into production workflows.
Gathered operational metrics to guide system improvements and data-driven decision-making.
Mentored students in software engineering and system analysis, encouraging innovation and applied technical skills.

title: Research Fellow
responsibilities: Built with a tech-enthusiast team an AI-powered browser extension to improve website accessibility for people with visual impairments.
Researched internet-usage patterns among disabled users and contributed to prototype design and usability evaluation.

title: Accredited Mental Health First Aider
responsibilities: Completed national certification to provide initial support for mental health challenges in workplace and community environments.

title: AI & ML Student Club Committee
responsibilities: Organised events, workshops, and collaborative initiatives to promote applied ML and AI research within the student community.

title: IT Researcher
achievements: Proposed a new automated solution to address persistent challenges in construction engineering.
Developed computer-vision and ML models to detect and estimate features from 2D floor plans, cutting manual identification effort significantly.
responsibilities: Designed and implemented algorithms using Python and PyTorch for floor-plan estimation.
Collaborated with domain experts to refine models and integrate them into existing workflows.
Analysed model performance, improved accuracy iteratively, and presented findings to stakeholders for further development.

title: Business Analyst
responsibilities: Worked in the top 10% of projects in the Start-up Wheel 2020 competition for innovative solutions.
Researched and scoped a unified payment platform covering public services, transportation, parking, university services, and F&B.

title: Daffodil Day Fundraising Volunteer
responsibilities: Collaborated with colleagues to raise NZ$11,000 for cancer-support services (~30% above target).
Organised collection activities, promoted awareness, and supported the annual appeal.

title: Application Developer
achievements: Kau Mau Te Wehi Award (2019) for enhancing the annual disaster-recovery exercise; ~10% faster than prior year.
Restructured a core MS SQL Server database schema to improve data-access efficiency and support migration processes.
responsibilities: Developed a Java/Spring Boot Disaster-Recovery application and microservices to modernise the workflow previously tracked in Excel sheets (JavaScript, OpenShift, Docker, MS SQL).
Analysed business requirements, researched solutions, and maintained documentation across the full SDLC.
Produced technical and user-facing guides to support adoption by technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Aligned software with business continuity objectives; performed DB operations (backups, restores, migrations).
